text: Ban Takhli railway station is a railway station located in Takhli Subdistrict, Takhli District, Nakhon Sawan, Thailand. It is located 193.017 km from Bangkok railway station and is a class 1 railway station. It is on the Northern Line of the State Railway of Thailand. The station opened on 31 October 1905 as part of the Northern Line extension from Lopburi to Pak Nam Pho. ==Train services== * Rapid 102 Chiang Mai-Bangkok * Rapid 105/106 Bangkok-Sila At- Bangkok * Rapid 108 Den Chai-Bangkok * Rapid 109 Bangkok-Chiang Mai * Rapid 111/112 Bangkok-Den Chai-Bangkok * Ordinary 201/202 Bangkok-Phitsanulok- Bangkok * Ordinary 207/208 Bangkok-Nakhon Sawan-Bangkok * Ordinary 209/210 Bangkok-Ban Takhli-Bangkok * Ordinary 211/212 Bangkok-Taphan Hin-Bangkok * Local 401/402 Lopburi-Phitsanulok-Lopburi == References == * Ichirō, Kakizaki (2010). Ōkoku no tetsuro: tai tetsudō no rekishi. Kyōto: Kyōtodaigakugakujutsushuppankai. * Otohiro, Watanabe (2013). Tai kokutetsu yonsenkiro no tabi: shasō fūkei kanzen kiroku. Tōkyō: Bungeisha. Category:Railway stations in Thailand Category:Railway stations opened in 1905 Category:1905 establishments in Siam
title: Ban Takhli railway station
